summary: Simon & Garfunkel were an American folk rock duo made up of Paul Simon and Art Garfunkel. They were very popular in the 1960s, with hits like "The Sound of Silence," "Mrs. Robinson," and "Bridge over Troubled Water." They met in school in New York City and started writing songs together. After some early success, they signed with Columbia Records and released their first album in 1964. Their music was featured in the movie "The Graduate." Despite their success, they broke up in 1970 due to disagreements. Both had successful solo careers. They reunited several times and are considered one of the greatest duos in music history, selling over 100 million records.
title: Simon & Garfunkel
